word: zestivate
description: to take a short nap in the middle of the day to boost creativity and energy

word: chromatherapy
description: the use of color-based treatments to improve mental and physical well-being

word: quixotica
description: a collection of whimsical and imaginative ideas or objects

word: serenitune
description: to hum or sing quietly to oneself to promote a sense of inner peace and calm

word: vellichor
description: the strange wistfulness of visiting a used bookstore, knowing that each book has its own story and history

word: scintigrate
description: to sparkle or glitter with an intense, almost scientific precision

word: auracle
description: a person who is highly attuned to the emotions and energy of those around them

word: chrysalism
description: the tranquility and peacefulness one feels when safely indoors during a thunderstorm

word: quaintrelle
description: a woman who emphasizes a life of passion, art, and style while maintaining a strong sense of self

word: melancholily
description: in a manner that is both sad and beautiful, often with a touch of nostalgia

word: soulstice
description: a moment of profound personal insight or revelation that aligns one's actions with their true purpose

word: novaturient
description: desiring or seeking powerful change in one's life or situation

word: etherealine
description: delicate, light, and almost too perfect for this world

word: zestential
description: essential for maintaining enthusiasm, energy, and zest for life

word: serendipitous
description: occurring by chance in a beneficial way; a blend of serendipity and adventurous

word: zestivate       verb    to take a short nap in the middle of the day to boost creativity and energy
chromatherapy   noun    the use of color-based treatments to improve mental and physical well-being
